name: Black Lace
description: '''Black Lace''' are a British pop band best known for [[novelty song|novelty]] party records, including their biggest hit "[[Agadoo]]" as well as "[[Superman (Black Lace song)|Superman]]" and "Do the Conga". They first came to the public eye when they represented the UK in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1979|1979 Eurovision Song Contest]] with the song "[[Mary Ann (Black Lace song)|Mary Ann]]". At that time, the band consisted of Colin Gibb (known as Colin Routh until 1987), Alan Barton, Steve Scholey and Terry Dobson. The band has undergone numerous line-up changes, with Scholey and Dobson leaving in 1981, followed by Barton in 1987, while Gibb, with the exception of a brief departure during 1986â€“1987, stayed until 2002. Since 2023, Black Lace has consisted of Phil Temple and 2008 ''[[Britain's Got Talent series 2|Britain's Got Talent]]'' contestant Craig Harper.
